dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we've all been hearing about this big Facebook ad boycott, right? #StopHateforProfits and all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we've all been hearing about this big Facebook ad boycott, right? Stop Hate for Profits and all that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With over 500 companies having now joined the advertising boycott of Facebook called for by top civil rights groups... as part of the #StopHateforProfits campaign, which has now grown to include more than 500 advertisers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Like, over 500 advertisers, big names pulling out. You'd think it would hit them hard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Like, over five hundred advertisers, big names pulling out. You'd think it would hit them hard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With over 500 companies having now joined the advertising boycott of Facebook called for by top civil rights groups...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, get this: Facebook is actually celebrating *record-breaking revenue* despite all of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, get this: Facebook is actually celebrating record-breaking revenue despite all of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...some investors are concerned about the companys lost revenuebut most Wall Street firms estimate that Facebook is still looking at less than a 5% hit to overall revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, what? Seriously? How does that even work? I thought they were, like, in trouble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Seriously? How does that even work? I thought they were, like, in trouble.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's, uh, pretty wild. Apparently, the boycott itself actually *boosted* their profile, ironically. Plus, they landed some huge partnerships â€“ Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin Donuts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's, uh, pretty wild. Apparently, the boycott itself actually boosted their profile, ironically. Plus, they landed some huge partnerships - Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin Donuts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...most recently joined by Pfizer, Lego and Dunkin Donutsannouncing that they will stop working with the tech giant as part of the #StopHateforProfits campaign...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, Dunkin Donuts? Okay. But what are the numbers looking like? Are Wall Street analysts, um, on board with this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, Dunkin Donuts? Okay. But what are the numbers looking like? Are Wall Street analysts, um, on board with this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not exactly. They *downgraded* shares, initially, but they're now expecting a boom in profits, like, a 5% revenue increase. And get this: shares *skyrocketed* 8% last Friday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not exactly. They downgraded shares, initially, but they're now expecting a boom in profits, like, a five percent revenue increase. And get this: shares skyrocketed eight percent last Friday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook shares initially plunged by 8% last Friday... Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Eight percent? That's, that's huge! So, uh, who's saying what specifically? Any analysts weighing in?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eight percent? That's, that's huge! So, uh, who's saying what specifically? Any analysts weighing in?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. Rohit Kulkarni from MKM Partners is predicting a revenue surge. And Morgan Stanley's Brian Nowak thinks if the top 100 advertisers came back, that's, like, a billion dollars *a month* more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. Rohit Kulkarni from M K M Partners is predicting a revenue surge. And Morgan Stanley's Brian Nowak thinks if the top one hundred advertisers came back, that's, like, a billion dollars a month more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue, said Rohit Kulkarni, an analyst for MKM Partners, in a recent note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A *billion* a month? That's insane. But, um, what about the boycott itself? Does it actually *hurt* them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A billion a month? That's insane. But, um, what about the boycott itself? Does it actually hurt them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, this is the really wild part. Citi analysts actually estimate that a one-month boycott would *boost* Facebook's stock by $1 a share. And if it continued? A *substantial gain* of $17 per share.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, this is the really wild part. Citi analysts actually estimate that a one-month boycott would boost Facebook's stock by one dollar a share. And if it continued? A substantial gain of seventeen dollars per share.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the ad boycott only lasts one month, according to Citi analysts, the likely impact on Facebooks stock is just $1 per share, and if Facebook is unable to convince the companies who are boycotting to resume business, the impact on its stock would be $17 per share, they estimate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [Disbelief] Wait, so the boycott... actually *helps* their stock price? That makes no sense!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so the boycott... actually helps their stock price? That makes no sense!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it's counter-intuitive, right? And Kulkarni also noted that advertisers were actually *increasing* spending during the pandemic, which, uh, significantly boosted revenues anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it's counter-intuitive, right? And Kulkarni also noted that advertisers were actually increasing spending during the pandemic, which, uh, significantly boosted revenues anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Advertisers were already winding down spending amid the coronavirus pandemic, Kulkarni notes...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the largest advertisers, they're not even participating in this boycott, or they're just, like, still spending big?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the largest advertisers, they're not even participating in this boycott, or they're just, like, still spending big?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Procter & Gamble, the largest advertiser in the world, they account for over half a percent of Facebook's revenue alone, and they're apparently 'eager to increase spending.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Procter and Gamble, the largest advertiser in the world, they account for over half a percent of Facebook's revenue alone, and they're apparently eager to increase spending.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Procter & Gamble, for example, is the largest advertiser in the world but is estimated to account for less than 0.50% of Facebooks revenues, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, um, the whole #StopHateforProfits campaign, it really didn't, like, dent their bottom line at all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, um, the whole Stop Hate for Profits campaign, it really didn't, like, dent their bottom line at all?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook shares initially plunged by 8% last Friday... most Wall Street firms estimate that Facebook is still looking at less than a 5% hit to overall revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, not really. It generated a lot of headlines, sure, but financially speaking, it seems Facebook is, uh, just fine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not really. It generated a lot of headlines, sure, but financially speaking, it seems Facebook is, uh, just fine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Wall Street firms generally remain quite bullish on the stock, with the large majority reiterating buy ratings...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. What a twist. So much for, like, collective action, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. What a twist. So much for, like, collective action, huh?
